official-title.#text:
To expand the research and education on and delivery of complementary and alternative medicine to
			 veterans, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Expansion of research and education on and delivery of complementary and alternative medicine to
			 veterans

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop a plan to expand materially and
			 substantially the scope of research and education on, and delivery and
			 integration of, complementary and alternative medicine services into the
			 health care services provided to veterans.

text.#text: Not later than six months after the effective date specified in

header.#text: Development of plan To expand research, education, and delivery

In carrying out

Director of the National Center on Complementary and Alternative Medicine of the National
			 Institutes of Health
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Center on Complementary and Alternative Medicine

text.#text: The
The

Institutions of higher education, private research institutes, and individual researchers with

			 integration of complementary and alternative medicine practices into the
			 delivery of health care.
Nationally recognized providers of complementary and alternative medicine.

Such other officials, entities, and individuals with expertise on complementary and alternative
			 medicine as the
The
To develop the plan.

To identify specific complementary and alternative medicine practices that, on the basis of
			 research findings or promising clinical interventions, are appropriate to
			 include as services to veterans.

To identify barriers to the effective provision and integration of complementary and alternative
			 medicine services into the delivery of health care to veterans, and to
			 identify mechanisms for overcoming such barriers.
